features/certificates.title: Certificates
features/certificates.description: We recommend using certbot after setting nginx on your server to maintain setup and automatic certificates renewal.

features/configuration.title: Configuration
features/configuration.description: BOOST provides the following configurations necessary for the operation of the server template. This section outlines the key settings required for administrative access, task scheduling with Celery, payment processing via Stripe, and email notifications through SMTP. All of these features can be edit and change in .env file.

features/routes.title: Routes API
features/routes.description: Boost provides structured support to create public, private, and admin routes, facilitating a modular approach to route management.

features/shop.title: Shop
features/shop.description: Boost provides EasyShop integration with stripe. It is focused around providing user easy way to fetch products from stripe and add programatic rewards.

features/tasks.title: Tasks
features/tasks.description: One of most important parts of having algorithms running on the server is to ability to schedule them to execute some work. This can be achieved with Boosts tasks distributed via Celery.

features/user_management.title: User Management
features/user_management.description: Boost provides basic of usermanagement, so you can start your app without worrying about how to log in users, store them or manage their password. All passwords are hashed, and user can be easily extented by modyfing models/user.py.

tutorial-basics/create_public_route.title: Create Public Route
tutorial-basics/create_public_route.description: This is standard feature provided by Flask. Boost divides routes and forms into seperate files, and these are divided into private, public, and only accessible by admin. All files serving routes and forms need to be registered (imported) to main/init.py.
